data.event: Settled in 1657, Lee was originally part of the extensive early Dover township.
Indians, incited by the government of New France, attacked Exeter on July 4, 1690.

event.title: overtook them at Wheelwright Pond on July 6, 1690

data.event: They were pursued by two infantry companies raised for the purpose, who overtook them at Wheelwright Pond on July 6, 1690.
In 1735, Durham, which included Lee, separated from Dover.
Then Lee, in turn, would separate from Durham on January 16, 1766 when it was established by Colonial Governor Benning Wentworth.
